bibl.title: Religion under Trajan. Plutarch's Resurrection of Osiris.
bibl.note: Paper presented at the conference "Sage and Emperor: Plutarch and Trajan", held June 24-27, 2000, at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. - Introduction. - Trajan, Egypt, and the Egyptian religion. - The temple at Philai. - Plutarch's Isis and Osiris and Trajan's reign. - Plutarch, social memory, and Egypt. - Plutarch's interest in Egypt throughout his works. - Egypt in the Caesar and Antony. - Plutarch's description of Egyptian religion, Osiris, and the contemporary scene. - Egyptian religion in Italy and the funeral cult of Osiris. - The emphasis on Osiris in the Isis and Osiris, and later religious history. - Conclusion.

bibl.title: Plutarch, Greek Intellectuals, and Roman Power in the Time of Trajan

bibl.seg: BRENK Frederick E., Religion under Trajan. Plutarch's Resurrection of Osiris.
Philip A. STADTER and Luc VAN DER STOCKT (Edd.), Plutarch, Greek Intellectuals, and Roman Power in the Time of Trajan (98-117 A.D.) (Leuven, 2002) pp. 73-92, 2 figg.

Paper presented at the conference "Sage and Emperor: Plutarch and Trajan", held June 24-27, 2000, at the University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill. - Introduction. - Trajan, Egypt, and the Egyptian religion. - The temple at Philai. - Plutarch's Isis and Osiris and Trajan's reign. - Plutarch, social memory, and Egypt. - Plutarch's interest in Egypt throughout his works. - Egypt in the Caesar and Antony. - Plutarch's description of Egyptian religion, Osiris, and the contemporary scene. - Egyptian religion in Italy and the funeral cult of Osiris. - The emphasis on Osiris in the Isis and Osiris, and later religious history. - Conclusion.
